Phono-semantic compound ( 形聲 / 形声 , OC *djeŋ ): semantic 戊 + phonetic 丁 ( OC *rteːŋ, *teːŋ ) . The phonetic component is not 囗 or 口 , as folk etymology states. According to Ji Xusheng 季旭昇, its original meaning was "city walls", with a reference to something protected conveyed by the weapon. Its original meaning is preserved in 城 .
